poem:
**A Meeting Deferred**

In fields of quiet resolve,   
leaders traverse to whisper promises,    
echoing Moldova's tender dawn.   
Yet amidst the quiet stride,   
there lies a distance unsolved—   
a war that wavers,   
hidden hopes entangled,   
yearning for light.   
Between the quiet words,   
a world desperately seeks peace,   
like rivers seeking gentle seas.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Putin wants to ‘wriggle out’ of meeting, Zelenskyy claims, and says Russia does not want to end war – Europe live 10.04am BST Macron, Merz, Tusk to visit Moldova in pro-EU signal ahead of elections French president Emmanuel Macron, German chancellor Friedrich Merz and Polish prime minister Donald Tusk will visit Moldova next week to celebrate Moldova’s independence day, the French president’s office said on Friday. “The leaders will reaffirm their full support for Moldova’s". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
